org.youscope.plugin.fluigent

Interface FluigentScriptCallback

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface FluigentScriptCallback
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Callback given to the Fluigent control script such that it can obtain its state, and set the flow rates and similar.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfFlowUnits

        int getNumberOfFlowUnits()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         ResourceException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Returns the number of flow units attached to the Fluigent device.
        Returns:
        Number of flow units.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ResourceException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • setFlowRate

        void setFlowRate(int flowUnit,
                 double flowRate)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 ResourceException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the flow rate of a given flow unit.
        Parameters:
        flowUnit - The ID (zero based) of the flow unit.
        flowRate - The flow rate, in the unit given by getFlowUnitShort().
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ResourceException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getFlowRate

        double getFlowRate(int flowUnit)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   ResourceException,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Returns the current flow rate of a given flow unit.
        Parameters:
        flowUnit - The ID (zero based) of the flow unit.
        Returns:
        The flow rate, in the unit given by getFlowUnitShort().
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ResourceException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getStateAsString

        java.lang.String getStateAsString(java.lang.String state,
                                  java.lang.String defaultValue)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the value of the state with the given name. If the state was not set before, the default value (i.e. the initial value) is returned.
        Parameters:
        state - Name of the state.
        defaultValue - Default value of the state. Typically used to set an initial value for the state when the controller is executed the first time.
        Returns:
        State value as a string.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getStateAsDouble

        double getStateAsDouble(java.lang.String state,
                        double defaultValue)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Returns the value of the state with the given name. If the state was not set before, the default value (i.e. the initial value) is returned.
        Parameters:
        state - Name of the state.
        defaultValue - Default value of the state. Typically used to set an initial value for the state when the controller is executed the first time.
        Returns:
        State value as a double.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

      • getStateAsInteger

        int getStateAsInteger(java.lang.String state,
                      int defaultValue)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Returns the value of the state with the given name. If the state was not set before, the default value (i.e. the initial value) is returned.
        Parameters:
        state - Name of the state.
        defaultValue - Default value of the state. Typically used to set an initial value for the state when the controller is executed the first time.
        Returns:
        State value as an integer.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

      • setState

        void setState(java.lang.String state,
              java.lang.String value)
       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sets the state with the given name to the given value. A state which is set in one evaluation can be read out in the next.
        Parameters:
        state - Name of the state.
        value - Value to set the state to
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        value - Value to set the state to
